sentence.Network_en: A century ago the aristocracy were truly lords of the earth.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Old French aristocratie, from Greek aristokratia, from aristos 'best' + -kratia 'power'. The term originally denoted the government of a state by its best citizens, later by the rich and well born, hence the sense 'nobility', regardless of the form of government (mid 17th cent.)

entry.def: The aristocracy is a class of people in some countries who have a high social rank and special titles.

means.word_mean: 1. a privileged class holding hereditary titles
2. the most powerful members of a society
